data.title: Science fiction hall of famer Samuel R. Delany to present at Atlantic Center for the Arts
authors: T.S. Jarmusz, Daytona Beach News-Journal Online
data.meta_description: As part of Stetson’s residency for the Master’s in Fine Arts program, science fiction hall of famer Samuel R. Delany will offer a reading of his work. \n The two-time Nebula award winner has been nomi…
data.text:
As part of Stetson’s residency for the Master’s in Fine Arts program, science fiction hall of famer Samuel R. Delany will offer a reading of his work.

The two-time Nebula award winner has been nominated in the genre for his writing numerous times and was inducted into the Science Fiction Hall of Fame in 2002. Delany was named the 31st Damon Knight Memorial Foundation Grand Master by the Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers of America in 2013. He has taught English and creative writing at Temple University.

Delany’s reading takes place at 8 p.m., Jan. 5 at the Atlantic Center for the Arts’ Joan James Harris Theater in New Smyrna Beach. The reading is free and open to public.
